title: [Health] In 2009, Colorado started a program to offer long-acting reversible contraceptives (e.g. IUDs) to low-income women. The initiative reduced births by approximately 20% among 15–19 year olds who lived near the clinics that were funded to offer IUDs.

[Health] Congenital malformation frequencies in children from the Bryansk region following the Chernobyl disaster (2000–2017): synergistic effects of radioactive and chemical pollutants on the frequencies of multiple congenital malformations
